existing_features.title: Build a responsive CraftyMini single-page marketing/landing experience that introduces the brand, showcases the main crochet product categories (Baby Booties, Hair Crochet Clips, Crochet Bow, Crochet Purse, Custom), and includes clear ordering and contact information.

Implement a clear 'Order Now' flow: add an Order Now button that scrolls to an order form collecting Name, Phone Number, Address, Item Name/Design, Category (Baby Booties / Hair Crochet Clip / Crochet Bow / Crochet Purse / Custom), Size, Color, Quantity, and an optional Notes field.

On order form submission, generate a mailto link to minicrafty63@gmail.com with a prefilled subject and body containing the customer’s entered details; also provide a clearly visible option to order via Instagram DM to @minicrafty.co�.

Add a 'Browse Our Collection' section that visually presents the 5 categories (Baby Booties, Hair Crochet Clips, Crochet Bows, Crochet Purses, Custom Orders) with short, descriptive copy and placeholder imagery (until real product photos are provided).

Include a 'Why Choose CraftyMini' section listing: Handmade with love & care; Unique & stylish designs for all ages; Perfect gifts for birthdays, weddings, or just because; Soft, safe, and high-quality materials.
Add a Contact Us section that shows the email minicrafty63@gmail.com and Instagram @minicrafty.co�, with both presented as clickable links where possible.

Establish and apply a coherent visual theme for CraftyMini (colors, typography, spacing, buttons, cards) suitable for a handmade/craft brand, and enforce it consistently across all sections without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Add the required static images to the frontend and render them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image routing).

Replace the 5 placeholder category images shown in the "Browse Our Collection" gallery (Baby Booties, Hair Crochet Clips, Crochet Bows, Crochet Purses, Custom Orders) with the specific user-uploaded images referenced by the IDs the user provided.

Add the user-uploaded gallery images as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and update the CategoryGrid image paths to point to the new filenames (do not route images through the backend).

Update the gallery/category grid to use the newly uploaded images by changing CategoryGrid.tsx so that the 'Baby Booties' card uses /assets/generated/1770877868282~2-2.png and the 'Hair Crochet Clips' card uses /assets/generated/1770877868282~2-3.png, leaving the other category images unchanged.

Ensure the user-uploaded images are present in the repository under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` with the exact filenames used by the UI, so they resolve on the live site at `/assets/generated/1770877868282~2-2.png` and `/assets/generated/1770877868282~2-3.png`.
Create and deploy Draft Version 5 after the uploaded images are correctly placed under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and verified to render on the live site.
Create and deploy Draft Version 6 after the asset placement and `src` updates are verified, and update `frontend/public/draft-version.txt` to indicate Version 6.
